solution_line_template: The total amount of money Mr. Eithan gave to his wife is {wife_fraction}*{stimulus_check_amount} = $<<{wife_fraction}*{stimulus_check_amount}={amount_to_wife}>>{amount_to_wife}
After giving his wife ${amount_to_wife}, he remained with ${stimulus_check_amount}-${amount_to_wife}=$<<{stimulus_check_amount}-{amount_to_wife}={remaining_after_wife}>>{remaining_after_wife}

He gave his first son {first_son_fraction} of the remaining amount which is {first_son_fraction}*${remaining_after_wife} = $<<{first_son_fraction}*{remaining_after_wife}={amount_to_first_son}>>{amount_to_first_son}

The total amount remaining after he gave his first {first_son_fraction} of the amount is ${remaining_after_wife}-${amount_to_first_son} = $<<{remaining_after_wife}-{amount_to_first_son}={remaining_after_first_son}>>{remaining_after_first_son}
He then gave his second son {second_son_percentage}*{remaining_after_first_son} = $<<{second_son_percentage}*{remaining_after_first_son}={amount_to_second_son}>>{amount_to_second_son} of the money.

After giving his second son ${amount_to_second_son}, the amount of money remaining that he saved in the family's saving account is ${remaining_after_first_son}-${amount_to_second_son}=${amount_in_savings}
